es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Class LookCommand

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.Command
      es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.LookCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class LookCommand
extends Command

Represents a Look command from the player that shows the description of the player location.

  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.lookCommand" which default value is "look".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.lookCommand.abbrev" which default value is "l".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.lookCommand.alt" which default value is "search".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.lookCommand.help" which default value is "look|l|search".

Constructor Detail

LookCommand

public LookCommand(Game game)
Constructs a Look command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. Default configuration is assumed at this moment.

Parameters:
game - The game.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'game' cannot be null.

LookCommand

public LookCommand(Game game,
                   java.util.Properties config)
Constructs a Look command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. The properties defined in the given configuration override those of the default configuration.

Parameters:
game - The game.
config - The configuration.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'game' and 'config' cannot be null.

setDefaultConfiguration

private void setDefaultConfiguration()
Sets the default configuration

setConfiguration

private void setConfiguration()
Parses the configuration from the configuration file

execute

public boolean execute()
Executes the Look command, obtaining as a result the description of the player location. This command may show only the description of the player location or the description plus the items that are in that location, depending on the configuration.

Overrides:
execute in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly executed; false otherwise.
See Also:
Command.execute()

parse

public boolean parse(java.lang.String line)
Parses a text line trying to identify a player invocation to this Look command (e.g. "look").

Specified by:
parse in class Command
Parameters:
line - The text line.
Returns:
true if the text line has been correctly parsed and the command correctly configured; false otherwise.

Command.parse(String)
